thread.title: Michigan Association of Nurse Anesthetists Announces New Board of Directors
thread.title_full: Michigan Association of Nurse Anesthetists Announces New Board of Directors - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Michigan Association of Nurse Anesthetists Announces New Board of Directors
text:
Michigan Association of Nurse Anesthetists
ANN ARBOR, Mich. , Oct. 14 . 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- The Michigan Association of Nurse Anesthetists [MANA] Monday announced their 2015-17 Board of Directors. The following Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists [CRNAs] will work to advance patient safety and access to anesthesia care throughout the state of Michigan . Andrea Teitel , CRNA, MS of West Bloomfield MI, President; Howie Drews , CRNA, MSN, of Jackson MI , President Elect; Stephen Blazoff , CRNA, MSN, of Grosse Pointe Farms, MI , Director District I Anne Hranchook,CRNA, DNP of Harrison Twp, MI , Director District III and John Mach , MSNA, CRNA, of Osseo, MI , Director District V. All of the board members will serve a two-year term. Board Members continuing their term include; Thomas Kolinsky , CRNA of Escanaba, MI , Secretary/ Treasurer; Greg Bozimowski , CRNA, DNP of Commerce Township, MI , Director District II, Mike Worden , CRNA of Marquette, MI , Director District IV; Andrew Beigner, CRNA, MSNA, FAAPM of Hillsdale, MI , Director District at Large.
CRNAs are advanced practice registered nurses who specialize in anesthesia care and who safely administer more than 40 million anesthetics to patients each year in the United States. CRNAs practice in every setting in which anesthesia care is delivered: hospitals, obstetrical delivery rooms, ambulatory surgery centers, doctor's offices and pain management.
MANA President Andrea Teitel states "It is an exciting time to be a CRNA in Michigan. CRNAs have been providing anesthesia care in the United States for over 150 years and we are willing and capable to meet the health care demands of the communities that depend on us. We collaborate with surgeons, anesthesiologists, dentists, podiatrists, and other qualified healthcare professionals to deliver safe, high-quality, and cost effective patient care in virtually every healthcare setting."
Nurse anesthetists have been the main providers of anesthesia care to U.S. military personnel on the front lines since World War I, including the current conflicts in the Middle East . According to a 1999 report from the Institute of Medicine, anesthesia care is nearly 50 times safer than in the 1980s. More information on nurse anesthesia can be found at www.aana.com , the website of the American Association of Nurse Anesthetists.
The Michigan Association of Nurse Anesthetists was founded in 1938. For more information about how Michigan CRNA's can help provide high quality and increase access to care for Michigan residents please visit www.smarthealthcaremi.com .
Contact: Jennifer Dickie
Phone: 734-477-0328
E-mail: jennifer@miana.org
